RT @ShellenbergerMD 22. Then, in July 2020, the FBI’s Elvis Chan arranges for temporary Top Secret security clearances for Twitter executives so that the FBI can share information about threats to the upcoming elections. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/FkW3daSUAAA4J_w.jpg

RT @ShellenbergerMD 21. Despite Twitter’s pushback, the FBI repeatedly requests information from Twitter that Twitter has already made clear it will not share outside of normal legal channels. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/FkW3NapVQAA6qTg.png

RT @ShellenbergerMD 20. Time and again, FBI asks Twitter for evidence of foreign influence & Twitter responds that they aren’t finding anything worth reporting. 

“[W]e haven’t yet identified activity that we’d typically refer to you (or even flag as interesting in the foreign influence context).” http://pbs.twimg.com/media/FkW2fe2UYAAQOPm.png http://pbs.twimg.com/media/FkW2jyiVsAEk910.jpg

RT @ShellenbergerMD 19. Pressure had been growing: 

“We have seen a sustained (If uncoordinated) effort by the IC [intelligence community] to push us to share more info & change our API policies.  They are probing & pushing everywhere they can (including by whispering to congressional staff).” http://pbs.twimg.com/media/FkW1bHuUEAA8CCC.png

No one is above the law.

And yes, that includes the former President.

Disgusting, corrupt FBI. https://twitter.com/shellenbergermd/status/1604888013422485505 QT @ShellenbergerMD 18. It's not the first time that Twitter's Roth has pushed back against the FBI. In January 2020, Roth resisted FBI efforts to get Twitter to share data outside of the normal search warrant process. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/FkW0u7yUUAEv4dA.png http://pbs.twimg.com/media/FkW1GHdUAAA7PsP.png

RT @ShellenbergerMD 14. Were the FBI warnings of a Russian hack-and-leak operation relating to Hunter Biden based on *any* new intel?
 
No, they weren't

“Through our investigations, we did not see any similar competing intrusions to what had happened in 2016,”  admitted FBI agent Elvis Chan in Nov. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/FkWusGjUAAAuoG-.png http://pbs.twimg.com/media/FkWusGiUYAErN5w.png http://pbs.twimg.com/media/FkWusGfUoAEgAxb.png http://pbs.twimg.com/media/FkWusG2UEAc4d9-.png

RT @ShellenbergerMD 13. They did the same to Facebook, according to CEO Mark Zuckerberg. “The FBI basically came to us [and] was like, ‘Hey... you should be on high alert. We thought that there was a lot of Russian propaganda in 2016 election. There's about to be some kind of dump similar to that.'" http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1604879835561488385/pu/img/Wr6pwD19gbkjLCN3.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1604879835561488385/pu/vid/480x270/3roueAkKbuLTmKnL.mp4?tag=14

This is unbelievable. https://twitter.com/shellenbergermd/status/1604879477732831235 QT @ShellenbergerMD 12. And yet, during all of 2020, the FBI and other law enforcement agencies repeatedly primed Yoel Roth to dismiss reports of Hunter Biden’s laptop as a Russian “hack and leak” operation. 

This is from a sworn declaration by Roth given in December 2020.

https://www.fec.gov/files/legal/murs/7827/7827_08.pdf http://pbs.twimg.com/media/FkWs5ECUcAYy0BE.png

This process was far from perfect, but ultimately it allowed Republican redlines to be adhered to and because of that I will urge my colleagues to support this package. We need to do our job and fund the government. https://www.appropriations.senate.gov/news/shelby-fy23-omnibus-package-strengthens-national-defense

Further, the omnibus appropriations legislation provides a significant down payment on critical disaster assistance for millions of Americans affected by recent storms and fires, as well as continued support for the Ukrainian people fighting for their freedom and survival.

I'm also very pleased that veterans’ health care costs will be funded as budgeted without using accounting gimmicks designed to enable more wasteful spending. And, once again, we rejected all poison pills while preserving crucial legacy riders. https://www.appropriations.senate.gov/news/shelby-fy23-omnibus-package-strengthens-national-defense

The non-defense funding level is an increase of only 5.5%, reducing the Administration’s wasteful non-defense budget request increase by more than half. https://www.appropriations.senate.gov/news/shelby-fy23-omnibus-package-strengthens-national-defense

Since day one, I've insisted on increasing defense funding well above POTUS’s request without similar increases in wasteful liberal non-defense spending. I’m pleased that this package meets the level set by the NDAA last week, which is $76B over last year – an increase of 10%.

After many months of ongoing negotiations, we have reached an agreement on an omnibus appropriations package to fund the government for the remainder of the current fiscal year. https://www.appropriations.senate.gov/news/shelby-fy23-omnibus-package-strengthens-national-defense

Any time you hear Democrats talk about what they are doing to “address the crisis”, that’s code language for “making sure migrants don’t have to wait in long lines that news cameras can see”.
Why can’t funds provided for “border management” also be used for “border security”? Because Democrats don’t want to secure the border.

The phrase “except for technology and capabilities to improve Border Patrol processing” means the funding can’t be used for Border Patrol to secure the border, but instead only to get migrants into our country more efficiently.
The phrase “except for internal transportation of noncitizens” means the funding should be used to move migrants throughout the country to a community near you.
The phrase “non-detention border management requirements” means that ICE can’t use the funding to detain or deport illegal aliens.

As a result, this funding, which Democrats will claim is to address the border crisis they created, will only make it worse by more quickly and comfortably resettling migrants in places like Tennessee.

"We know now, the first mandatory audit was opened two years into his presidency. On the same day this Committee requested his returns."

“The Committee expected that these mandatory audits were being conducted promptly and in accordance with IRS policies. However, our review found that under the prior Administration the program was dormant."

“We are only here today because four years ago, our request to learn more about the program under 6103 was denied. This was the first time that this key oversight function was hampered, and our Committee’s jurisdiction was challenged."
“A president is no ordinary taxpayer. They hold power and influence unlike any other American. And with great power comes even greater responsibility."

"Our voluntary collection relies on the public confidence that our tax laws are applied evenly and justly, regardless of position or power. For four years, the Committee has been reviewing how the IRS enforces the federal tax laws against, and ensures compliance by, a president."
"We all come to Ways and Means with the goal of creating a fairer tax code. Because at the root of it all, it is our federal tax system that funds the democracy we all cherish and love."

Chairman @RepRichardNeal: "Ways and Means is entrusted with great responsibilities. Today, the weight of our job is heavy. Congress serves as a check on the Executive Branch, and our Committee is entrusted with oversight of our revenue system."

I voted in favor in order to properly inform consideration of legislation to require the IRS to audit future President’s tax returns in a timely and comprehensive manner.

Today, the Committee deliberated on the report of the investigation in an hours long, closed door session. The Committee ultimately voted to release the report with supporting documentation—including several years of President’s Trumps returns— to the full House.

This Congress, the Ways and Means Committee conducted an investigation of the 1977 Mandatory Audit Policy and discovered that the policy was not well defined and poorly executed, to the point of being dormant.
Americans need to be able to trust that the President pays taxes like anyone else. That is why in 1977 the IRS implemented a policy of mandatory examination (audit) of Presidential tax returns.
I did not make this decision lightly. From our founding, the United States was established to be a nation ruled by laws, not kings. No one is above the law, including and especially the President.
